metadata.title: CVE-2020-14853 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Cluster product of Oracle MySQL (component:Cluster: NDBCluster Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are8.0.21 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLCluster. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person otherthan the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Clusteraccessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial ofservice (partial DOS) of MySQL Cluster. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.6 (Integrityand Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:L).

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
